messages.title: 60 SECOND Q&A WITH DEBI JONES
messages.content: Questions about the need for a change of government, the challenges a future Conservative government will face, local connections of an MP, the type of MP Debi Jones aims to be, and challenges specific to Sefton Central

messages.title: A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM DAVID CAMERON
messages.content: Discussion about change in Britain, economy, NHS, jobs and apprenticeships, council tax, state pension, tax benefits, Sure Start, and the choice at the election.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Believes in economic stability and social responsibility, and making tough decisions to save for tougher futures.

issues.economy: Bridging the gap between rich and poor, ensuring economic stability and social responsibility.
issues.education: Support for Sure Start and providing 4,200 extra Sure Start health visitors.
issues.environment: Coastal defenses and flooding must be appropriately managed and action taken on green belt preservation.
issues.health: Plans to increase spending on NHS and a commitment to improving services.
issues.socialWelfare: Raise the basic state pension, tackle benefit fraud, freeze council tax for two years.

housing.content: Help local councils to freeze council tax for two years.

leaflet.personalStatement: Debi Jones pledges to always remain local and committed to her constituency, aiming to serve as a positive influence.

images.caption: Photos of Debi Jones engaged in community activities.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Debi Jones is Vice-President of Aintree Hospital League of Friends and actively involved in fundraising activities.
